chapter.title: On-boarding Districts
chapter.para: On-boarding is the process of setting up your district to use &PRODUCTABBR;. The on-boarding process involves setting up user accounts, ingesting data for your district into the &PRODUCTABBR; Data Store, and (if applicable) enabling applications to access the data you have ingested.
Most districts will on-board using the process described in .

section.title: On-boarding With Bulk Ingestion
section.para: Use the following steps for on-boarding with bulk ingestion:

step.para: &OPERATORROLE; creates an SEA Administrator using the Administrative Account Management Tool. See .
SEA Administrator creates a Realm Administrator and an Ingestion User using the Manage Administrator Accounts system tool. See .
Ingestion User prepares files for ingestion. See the &COMPANYABBR; data ingestion guide, available for download from the &DEVWEBSITE;.
Ingestion User logs into &COMPANYABBR; and creates a landing zone. See .
Realm Administrator creates a realm. See .
SEA Administrator creates LEA Administrator in the Local Level Education Agency. See .
LEA administrator approves Data Browser application, or a third party application created for the district, to access data. See .

section.para: Once this process is complete, any staff included in the ingestion data that have an IT Administrator role can log into the system and make API calls through any approved application.

section.title: On-boarding SIF Districts
section.para: Districts that use SIF data also on-boarding using bulk ingestion. However, SIF data must be converted into an Ed-Fi compliant format before it can be ingested to the &PRODUCTABBR; Data Store. Districts that use SIF data should work with CPSI to format and ingest their data.
Use the following steps to on-board a district that uses SIF data:

step.para: Contact CPSI for assistance in formatting and ingesting SIF data.
&OPERATORROLE; creates an SEA Administrator using the Manage Administrator Accounts system tool. See .
SEA Administrator creates an Ingestion User account for CPSI using the Administrative Account Management Tool. See .

note.para: The SEA Administrator should work with CPSI to make sure the account has the proper credentials.

step.para: SEA Administrator creates a Realm Administrator using the Manage Administrator Accounts system tool. See .
SEA Administrator creates a landing zone and shares the landing zone information with CPSI. See .

note.para: The SEA Administrator should work with CPSI to ensure that the landing zone is created properly for CPSI use during ingestion.

step.para: CPSI uses the Ingestion User account and the landing zone to ingest data into the &PRODUCTABBR; Data Store on behalf of the SIF district.
Realm Administrator creates a realm. See .
SEA Administrator creates LEA Administrator in the Local Level Education Agency. See .
LEA administrator approves Data Browser application, or a third party application created for the district, to access data. See .

section.para: Once this process is complete, any staff included in the ingestion data that have an IT Administrator role can log into the system and make API calls through any approved application.

section.title: On-boarding With Minimal Ingestion
section.para: On-boarding with minimal ingestion is an atypical process used to resolve issues a district may have when trying to on-board via bulk ingestion. Do not follow this process unless you are sure that it applies to your district.
Use the following steps to on-board with minimal ingestion:

step.para: &OPERATORROLE; creates an SEA Administrator using the Administrative Account Management Tool. See .
SEA Administrator creates a Realm Administrator and an Ingestion User using the Manage Administrator Accounts system tool. See .
Ingestion User modifies provided XML files to match the setup for their district. See .
Ingestion User updates the MainControlFile.ctl file. See .
Ingestion User logs into &PRODUCTABBR; and creates a landing zone. See .
Realm Administrator creates a realm. See .
SEA Administrator creates LEA Administrator in the Local Level Education Agency. See .
LEA administrator approves Data Browser application, or a third party application created for the district, to access data. See .

section.para: Once this process is complete, any staff included in the ingestion data that have an IT Administrator role can log into the system and make API calls through any approved application.

section.title: Template File Set Up for On-boarding With Minimal Ingestion
section.para: Before data can be ingested, the Ingestion User must download and set up the provided template files. The template files include the following:

listitem.para: InterchangeEducationOrganization.xml - used to set up the hierarchy of education organizations, including the state and the local systems (district, county, etc.) that fall under the state.
InterchangeStaffAssociation.xml - used to create the Staff entity for a local level education organization
MainControlFile.ctl - defines the set of inbound XML data to be ingested

section.para: Use the following steps to set up the template files:

step.para: Get the template files from your &OPERATORROLE;.

Open InterchangeEducationOrganization.xml and replace the data in the file with the data specific to your organization. For example, you would replace _ID of State Level Education Organization_ with the ID for your state.

note.para: The data you provide in the XML file must exactly match any data for your state and district that is already contained in the data store. If there are conflicts, the data in the XML file will not ingest properly.

step.para: When you have updated the file be sure to save all of your changes.
Open InterchangeStaffAssociation.xml and replace the data in the file with the data specific to the staff in your district.

note.para: As previously stated, the data you provide in the XML file must exactly match any data for your district that is already contained in the aata store.

step.para: When you have finished updating the file, be sure to save all your changes.

Create a zip file that contains the updated InterchangeEducationOrganization.xml, InterchangeStaffAssociation.xml, and MainControlFile.ctl files. For proper ingestion, this zip file must not contain any folders and should only contain those three files.

note.para: You can download and use the Ingestion Validation Tool to validate your zip file.
